title: Synthetic Recap
body:
SACRAMENTO – On a night when the offense could have stalled, the Chicago Bulls demonstrated why they are a dynasty, not merely a team. They dismantled the Sacramento Kings, 111-93, but this was no ordinary road victory. This was a coronation of one of the game's greatest, a virtuoso performance by the incomparable Michael Jordan.

From the opening tip, Jordan was uncontainable. He sliced through the Kings’ defense with a ruthless efficiency, piling up points from every conceivable angle. The mid-range jumper was automatic, the drives to the basket were unstoppable, and the defensive pressure he applied fueled the Bulls’ trademark fast break. He wasn't just scoring; he was orchestrating a masterpiece.

The Kings, simply put, had no answer. While Mitch Richmond fought valiantly to keep Sacramento within striking distance, contributing 24 points, the home crowd at ARCO Arena bore witness to a force of nature. Every time the Kings threatened to close the gap, Jordan would respond with a demoralizing basket, a steal, or a key assist, his competitive fire snuffing out any flicker of hope.

When the final horn sounded, the stat sheet told a historic tale: a game-high 44 points for His Airness. It was a performance that reminded everyone why he reigns supreme, a scoring clinic that powered the Bulls to another decisive win. On this night, the story wasn't just about Chicago's victory, but about Michael Jordan's enduring, unstoppable greatness.
